commitResults.messageTitle: Changed the exit function to explicitly exit
Adding the adding and listing task feature
Added the ability to mark and unmark tasks as done
Added utils class for reusable methods
Added support for multiple tasks types
Added tracking of todos, events and deadlines
Changed name of certain test files
Added error checking for the task array
Added error handling with custom exceptiosn
Added usage requirements when a invalid command is inputted
Changed the data structure to store tasks to be an ArrayList
Added the ability for the user to delete tasks
Added checks to ensure integer arguments are integers

commitResults.messageBody:
When a file being read or written to. There are no exceptions in
the case where a file is not writable or readable.

Not being writable or readable should be considered a checked error

Add not being writable and readable as custom duke exceptions.

Making custom exceptions allow for custom behavior for these errors
that align with the requirements of the project

Reading and writing to files have to be done separately in each class
that uses it.

The reading and writing to files can be abstracted to avoid code
duplication.

Create a file handler class to abstract these details. Modify he
exceptions handling the read and write permissions to be more helpful.

Less boilerplate needs to be written for file reading and writing.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to save and load
commitResults.messageBody:
Users had to enter all the task details and this was not persistent
across user sessions.

Add the ability to save and load. Save files have the format of tasks
being separated by newlines and different attributes of tasks are
separated by commas. The program will parse and unparse this when
saving and loading. Saving and loading is done via the SaveHandler
class. Classes that can be saved implements the Saveable interface. Add
the SaveData class to contain the data that needs to be saved.
Update the text-ui-test tests. Update .gitignore to account for the
new save files. Add InavlidSaveException class to handle exceptions for
invalid formatting of the save file.

The SaveHandler class is to abstract away saving. The SaveData class
is to encapsulate the test data to make updating it in the foture
easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change description of the format to save
commitResults.messageBody:
Used an older version of the save format as a comment.

Needs to be updated to the newer version of the save format.

Update the comment to reflect the newer save format.

To make it consistent for other people looking at the code and for
future me.

commitResults.messageTitle: Change exceptions to be more user friendly
commitResults.messageBody:
Exceptions were less descriptive.

Users may not know how to deal with the error.

Change error messages to be more descriptive on what to do.

Any help for the user would be nice, especially in a command line
application.

commitResults.messageTitle: Delete unused functions in Utils class
commitResults.messageBody:
The method joinStringArray() is unused.

Unused methods should be removed.

Remove the joinStringArray() method from the Utils class.

This would make it easier for other developers to read.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add date and time formatting and parsing
commitResults.messageBody:
The bot uses the raw dates/times from the user with no regard to
formatting.

Program could need to check certain properties in regards to the
date/time. Date/time display also should be standardized.

Let's,
- Add methods to parse, unparse and display date/times
- Update the test cases
- Change the task classes and chatbot to use the
parsing/unparsing/display methods
- Have the chatbot account for the fact that if the user enters the
date/time format incorrectly
- Account for the fact that the save files can be incorrect

Having the tasks use LocalDateTime objects can make further
implementation such as listing tasks in a specific time period easier.

commitResults.messageTitle: Abstract parsing logic into Parser class and make Command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Parsing/command logic is in the class of the chatbot.

This makes the responsibility of both parsing and command logic
fall into the chatbot's hands. This also makes parsing and logic highly
coupled with the chatbot.

Let's do,
- Abstract command logic into their corresponding class
- Make Command as a class for shared logic amongst commands
- Abstract parsing logic into its own class
- Fix other minor issues
- Remove unnecessary methods from chatbot class
- Account for command and parsing logic in the chatbot class

The parser should return a Command object and the chatbot should
execute the command. This completely separates their logic.
If there is an error with the parsing, it has to do with the format
of the argument. Whereas if there is a problem with executing the
command, is has not much to do with how the user formatted their
argument. This separates the logic and reduces coupling as well.

Classes are in the source folder without being associated with a
package other than the classes in the exceptions folder.

This is poor organisation and quite messy.

Divide classes into folders that make sense:
- Various tasks classes into the tasks folder
- Ui components go into the ui folder
- Utility functions and classes go into utils folder
- Save and storage classes go into the storage folder
- Exceptions go into the exceptions folder
- The various commmand classes go into the Command folder
Also, change cases to accommodate new file paths.

Improves maintainability, readability, scalability as well
as code reusability. This is a relatively smaller project so do not
need that many nested folders.
